security_audit.summary: This skill contains only workflow documentation with no executable code. The static scanner produced false positives by misinterpreting markdown syntax and documentation text. All patterns flagged as cryptographic algorithms, backtick execution, and reconnaissance are legitimate documentation formatting and GitHub CLI workflow instructions.

content.user_title: Implement AI Agent Quality Control Workflow
content.value_statement: Stop accepting mediocre code reviews from AI agents. This workflow enforces a 4-step loop that guarantees 10/10 quality and 100% issue coverage before any code is presented. Agents must fix, review, iterate, and present with mandatory GitHub PR posting.
actual_capabilities: Enforces 4-step fix-review-iterate-present loop for AI agents
Mandates GitHub PR review posting (not optional)
Demands 10/10 review score with zero suggestions
Provides detailed delegation templates with success criteria
Includes anti-pattern examples and common mistakes
limitations: Requires agents with GitHub PR posting capabilities
Works only with tasks that produce code changes
Maximum 5 iterations before human escalation needed
Needs GitHub CLI access for issue/PR management

use_cases.title: Enforce Code Quality Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure AI agents deliver production-ready code with mandatory reviews and complete issue coverage before human review.

use_cases.title: Automate PR Quality Gates
use_cases.description: Coordinate AI contributors through a rigorous quality loop that guarantees 10/10 reviews and full requirement implementation.

use_cases.title: Standardize Agent Workflows
use_cases.description: Implement consistent quality control across all AI agent tasks with documented workflows and clear acceptance criteria.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Task Delegation
prompt_templates.scenario: Simple bug fix with clear requirements

Requirements: 1) Session expires after 24h, 2) Refresh token works, 3) Error on dual expiration, 4) Redirect on failure. Success: ALL 4 implemented, tests pass. After reviewing with Skill(code-reviewer), POST review to GitHub and report with PR link.

prompt_templates.title: Feature Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement user profile editing (Issue #123). Requirements from issue: Backend API endpoint, Frontend form with validation, Database migration, Unit tests for all components. Success: ALL requirements implemented, 100% test coverage. Create PR, review with Skill(code-reviewer), POST review to GitHub.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor payment service (Issue #89). Requirements: Extract payment logic to separate module, Add retry mechanism for failed payments, Implement circuit breaker pattern, Update all dependent services. Success: Zero breaking changes, all tests pass, performance improved. Review and POST to GitHub PR.

best_practices: Always include ALL requirements from the issue in your delegation prompt
Verify agent posted review to GitHub before accepting completion
Use line-by-line requirement verification table for final coverage check
anti_patterns: Never accept mostly done or partial issue coverage
Do not skip the review step even if code looks correct
Avoid presenting without clickable PR and issue URLs

faq.question: What happens if the agent cannot achieve 10/10 review score?
faq.answer: After 5 iterations, escalate to human with details. The workflow enforces quality standards and does not compromise on 10/10 requirements.

faq.question: Can this work with private GitHub repositories?
faq.answer: Yes, as long as the agent has proper GitHub CLI authentication and repository access permissions for creating PRs and posting reviews.

faq.question: How do I verify 100% issue coverage?
faq.answer: Use the line-by-line verification table format provided. Extract all requirements from the issue and check each one against the implementation.

faq.question: What if requirements are unclear in the issue?
faq.answer: Ask for clarification before delegating. The workflow requires 100% coverage of all requirements, so unclear requirements must be clarified first.

faq.question: Can agents work on multiple issues simultaneously?
faq.answer: Yes, but each issue must have 100% coverage. Create separate PRs or ensure one PR addresses all issues with proper linking.

faq.question: Is GitHub PR posting really mandatory?
faq.answer: Yes, absolutely mandatory. Reviews must be visible on the PR page for human evaluation. Local-only reviews mean the task has failed.
